meanings.definition: Aphonias: the inability to produce speech sounds
meanings.sent1: After the accident, he developed aphonias and could no longer speak.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed her with aphonias after she lost her ability to talk.
meanings.sent3: When the comedian suddenly had aphonias, the audience thought it was part of the act.
meanings.sent4: Her aphonias felt like a heavy weight on her chest, silencing her words.
meanings.sent5: The aphonias in the room was so thick, you could almost touch the silence.

meanings.definition: Aphonias: a condition resulting in the loss of voice or inability to speak
meanings.sent1: The singer's aphonias meant she had to cancel her concert.
meanings.sent2: Aphonias can be a frustrating experience for those affected.
meanings.sent3: His sudden aphonias made him the quietest person in the room.
meanings.sent4: The aphonias of the forest at night was eerie and unsettling.
meanings.sent5: The aphonias of the library was broken only by the turning of pages.
